vsParam:
Anise! I've prepared the item you asked for.
Here you are!

Wow... Thank you very much!
This flower should be able to bounce back!

Mix the "Round Feces" into the soil...
And then water the flower...

Wow, so impressive!
Look, it blooms!
It's wonderful to see the flower flourishing again

Thank you so much!
You really are a big help!

Ha ha, no need for bravado.
Just take the compliment and be happy about it. Look, look.

Hehe, thank you so much,
[px]. You really are a big help!

I'm going to hand in the investigation report to Ru Sensei.
[px], you guys should come with me.

And I want to tell Ru Sensei the truth that
if it weren't for the help of [px] and Peppermint...

Well...
I'll give you a pass if I only look at the report itself.
This assignment is deliberately making things difficult.

Ha ha, don't get upset.
I also have my own concerns.

I'm sorry, Anise.
This assignment was meant to challenge you.

I purposely gave you a malnourished plant.
I just wanted to see how you would handle the assignment.
Oh, so this assignment was actually a test for Anise?

You are brilliant, and you stand out among all the
apprentice sages I've instructed and supervised.

Nevertheless, you will sooner or later encounter difficulties.
This is very common for a sage who studies the unknown.

I designed this assignment to see...
how you would react when you run into such a problem.

Wow...
Ru Sensei, that was mean...

Humph, I'm just doing what a teacher should do.
That doesn't make me a bad person.

Hehe, thank you, Ru Sensei.
Now I get it... the purpose of this assignment.

OK. Now please excuse me.
I have to get back to continue my research.

Hmm, that was pretty complicated...
But it's great that we've finished the assignment, right?

That's right...
I couldn't have done it without [px] and Peppermint.

However, my ecological survey is not over.
Also, to begin with, I didn't see the true purpose of the assignment.

Next time I hand in an assignment it will be perfect!
I'll have to work even harder to do so!

Ha ha ha... that's Anise...
It's good to be diligent, but don't overwork yourself!
